records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010250 -  CRIM 0053 Work Order Number - Hour Meter  (Ref:IN:00010250)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Thu, May 11, 2023 12:43 PM
To: michelle.wortel@hoist.tech
Cc: dayadra.dharmasena@hoist.tech
Subject: Incident #00010250 -  CRIM 0053 Work Order Number - Hour Meter  (Ref:IN:00010250)

hi Michelle,


After working on this issue we have found out that we cannot add the WO_NO custom field to the "new measurements" list on the measurements for object page. Due to the following reasons the custom field we create does not appear in the relevant view of the "new measurements" list.


The view used by the  "new measurements" list is created by combining multiple tables. Therefore even though we create a custom field on the relevant LU it still wont show up on the view of new  "new measurements" list, because the list is created by multiple tables.

The Entity name(LU) has been changed to a different name from the client side file(projection file) in the cloud.
Please contact me if you do have any further queries regarding this.


Best Regards,
Ghazi Ismail

hi Michelle,

After working on this issue we have found out that we cannot add the WO_NO custom field to the "new measurements" list on the measurements for object page. Due to the following reasons the custom field we create does not appear in the relevant view of the "new measurements" list.

  1. The view used by the  "new measurements" list is created by combining multiple tables. Therefore even though we create a custom field on the relevant LU it still wont show up on the view of new  "new measurements" list, because the list is created by multiple tables.

BQA-09579 - Customization on the Sales Tab of the Work Task
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: We would like to implement an expedited process to adjust markups on Fabrication Work Orders.  Currently, the only way to edit markups on the fly is to navigate to each line on the Sales Tab and type in the markup required.  This can become quite cumbers
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c: We would like to implement an expedited process to adjust markups on Fabrication Work Orders.  Currently, the only way to edit markups on the fly is to navigate to each line on the Sales Tab and type in the markup required.  This can become quite cumbersome, as most Work Orders have tens of Sales Lines.  The proposed solution will implement a numerical data field and a command button “Apply Markup” onto the Sales tab of the Work Task.  This will allow the user to checkmark the lines they wish to markup, type the markup amount, and apply the markup to the selected lines. This will be especially helpful when we have large Work Orders with hundreds of lines to change.

Title__c: BQA-09461 - SERVICE - Manufacture change request in lieu of LOV, make an editable field
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: We modified a few of the fields within the Equipment Object Navigator Functional Object. To be consistent and to make it easier when adding new equipment, I would like to have the “Manufacturer” as an Editable field and not a LOV. The reason we would lik
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c: We modified a few of the fields within the Equipment Object Navigator Functional Object. To be consistent and to make it easier when adding new equipment, I would like to have the “Manufacturer” as an Editable field and not a LOV. The reason we would like this is 1) It would be consistent with the other fields such as UNIT ID, MODEL, SERIAL AND AREA SERVED 2) If the manufacturer is not listed, you’ll be required to go to another place in IFS and add the new manufacturer name. It’s not intuitive to remember exactly where to go.  We are OK if someone spells Trane or TRANE or Train, we can easily fix any typos. Ken Bradley and I spoke about this and this should be an easy update.

Title__c: Custom event for restrict the reservation and issue in a shop order
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Hi Hoist team!
Hope you are all ok! :)

Could you please help us in the development of a custom event that only allow to reserve and issue material in a shop order from the location that is in the “Reserve/Issue from Loc” field in “Shop Order>Materials
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Hi Hoist team!
Hope you are all ok! :)

Could you please help us in the development of a custom event that only allow to reserve and issue material in a shop order from the location that is in the “Reserve/Issue from Loc” field in “Shop Order>Materials” window (screenshot attached).
If the field is empty the custom event must NOT restrict the reservation and issue of that line in the shop order.
Only applies for sites 11201 and 11202
Probably other sites will be added please ensure to setup the custom event friendly so internally we can add more sites just in case.

Thanks!
BMCServiceDesk__incidentResolution__c:
2 events developed to handle the validation issue and reserve.
C_SHOP_MAT_REC_VALID
C_SHOP_MAT_REC_VALID_ISS
